sections.snippet:
If a module is required from within a project and not from `node_modules`, then a path relative to the current file must be provided. This is nice because it is very explicit, but it makes refactoring directory structures difficult.

To use path aliases, try the [ral](https://www.npmjs.org/package/ral) npm. It allows one to define path aliases in a separate file, so if the path to a module changes, it's location must only be updated in one spot.

Do not use `ral` for things loaded from `node_modules`.
sections.title: Require
